descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...turn fill the color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...In the input, you should see...turn fill the color
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...In the input, you should see...turn fill the color

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square made of 4 panels. 1 or more of the panels will be red. The other panels will be a different color.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same grid size as the input.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...duplicate the grid. Beginning with the red colored panel(s), extend squares of the different color all the way to the edge. The result should be diagonal squares extending from the red panels. The result should be the same non-red color.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 2x2 object made up of two different colors, one color should be red.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the same as the input grid.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...extend the pattern out. Look at the red square or squares. Whichever directions has a red square, is the direction it needs to be extended, except it should be in the other color. It will go up or down and to the left or right, depending on the direction of the red square. If the red square is on the bottom right, then the pattern will extend all the way to the bottom right corner. It would go: down one, make that the other color, over one, make that the other color. This happens for each colored square of the original 2x2. After you are done, make sure to turn the red square into the other color too.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see.... colored square blocks
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...if you have a colored square block in the center of the grid that is the color you will only have on the output. If you do not have a color in the exact center of the grid, use the color that is the most abundant for your output grid. Create a 3x3 grid going diagonal.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...A square pattern with at least one red color square
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...same as input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...extend the pattern in the direction that the red square is located on the square

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...A square pattern with at least one red color square
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...Same as input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Extend the pattern in the direction that the red square is located on the square If more than one corner but a red square, extend all corners to the edge by the width of the square.  Pattern should go up one and over one by a width of two.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 2x2 grid made up of two different colors.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid size.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make a consecutive stair step pattern branching out from the odd color, probably red.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 9x9 grid with a 4x4 square pattern on it. The pattern will have two colors on it, with at least one of those colors being red.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...remains the same.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...take note of which direction the red block (or blocks are pointing). Using the other color in the block (NOT red), start making a chain of interlocking block patterns until you reach the end of the grid. If there are more than one red block then you will have multiple extensions.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 2x2 colored object and one is orange.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should be the same as the input.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use the other color to extend based on the location of the oranged grid to the border. In the border, fill the one black grid with that color.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a  square pattern  with at least one red color square
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... same as input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... the pattern in the direction that the red square is located on the square if more  than one corner a red square  extend all corners  to the edge by the width of the square pattern should go up one and over by a width of two

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...A square pattern with at least one red color square
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...Same as input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Extend the pattern in the direction that the red square is located on the square. If more than one corner has a red square, extend all corners to the edge by the width of the square.  Pattern should go up one and over one by a width of two.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... You will see a block of 2x2 pixels that has a (or a) red pixel
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...Same as input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Your task is to extend the pixels to one end of the space; for that, you will need to look in which direction the red pixel is. If there is only one red pixel, then you will extend the square to the top of the space you indicate; if there are two red pixels, you will extend them to the direction you indicate; if there are three, too. Space is the same width as the original square.
